meanings.definition: A new growth on a plant, typically a young shoot.
meanings.sent1: The tiny sprout peeked out from the soil.
meanings.sent2: I planted the seed and watched the sprout emerge.
meanings.sent3: The sprout seemed to wave hello as it grew taller.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like sprouts, growing rapidly in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The sprout's green color was vibrant against the brown earth.

meanings.definition: To begin to grow or develop.
meanings.sent1: The seeds will sprout when watered regularly.
meanings.sent2: After the rain, the plants will sprout quickly.
meanings.sent3: The idea began to sprout in his mind like a small seed.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence sprouted like a flower in bloom.
meanings.sent5: Hope can sprout even in the darkest of times.
